name: Saltmarch Flats
role_in_state: Primary salt & reagent supplier; tidal provisioning hub
economy_niches: reef-harvested ritual reagents (resins, mineral salts, dried algal products)
boat provisioning, ropework and hull-smithing for small craft
seasonal salt auctions and brokers for long-distance traders
culture_adjustments: tide-based calendar dominates work cycles and festivals
local salt-guilds wield greater social/legal power than distant ship guilds
Coastal Tongues dialect heavy with salvage, drying and brining terminology
ritual life centered on reef-offerings and drying rites tied to harvest tides
high seasonal labor migration for harvest windows; transient settlements common
constraints: very limited fresh water; reliant on imports
brine environment prevents heavy metallurgy and long-lived machinery
reef reagent harvests legally restricted and seasonally limited
notes: seasonal salt harvests drive labor flows and local markets
salt flats serve as nautical landmarks and legal markers for leases
critical node in ritual reagent supply chains for state magic practices
